title: What is the purpose of lowering Wind Slash missile speed?
body:
Is that what Riot considers a nerf? Am I supposed to be happy that now Riven's ult isn't faster than my flash and will just kill me a quarter of a second later?

You guys do this every single time. You "nerf" random shit that isn't even part of the reason that makes that champion OP or a nightmare to lane against patch after patch and we're left still trying to explain to you that Riven's fucking ult speed isn't what makes her good it's the fact that she can initiate against me half the fucking way across top lane and still chain CC me twice and execute me ALL WHILE GAINING A SHIELD MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE FOR ME TO FIGHT BACK.

BUT IT'S OK. AT LEAST HER ULT WILL KILL ME SLOWER NOW. THANKS RITO.

replies.body:
We're testing a reduction to Riven's ult's travel speed to give her opponents a bit more time to react to it at longer range. The idea is that it should be more realistic to get off a clutch flash, heal or shield to save yourself or someone else if Riven's not directly on top of you when she uses Windslash. 

Windslash speed certainly isn't one of Riven's core strengths and that's the reason we're hitting it. It's an opportunity to cut a bit of power off a champion we think's a bit strong without having to nerf her in a way that affects the things she's meant to be good at.

It seems that people still don't get that you guys prefer to nerf weaknesses, not strengths.

Otherwise, I'm not on PBE. But I like the idea of the nerf. I play Riven here and there, and I've always thought her ult was just "too easy." I've secured kills I shouldn't have with it, I've stolen Dragons with it. Iv'e also died to it knowing it was coming.

The problem is, some people want to see Riven gutted, while others want no change whatsoever. No one seems to want the middle ground.

Yup, if we can find a way to make strengths stronger and weaknesses more pronounced that's generally the direction we prefer to go. Goal there is to try and make (or keep) champions distinct from each other so that they impact other players in different ways, require different skills to master, allow you to pull off unique stuff etc. We will sometimes have to hit a champion's strengths if they're fundamentally problematic, it's not our first choice of approach though.

That begs the question, what prominent weaknesses does Riven have? Squishy early game? Cool down reliant? Ranged harass? Those aren't weakness of Riven, exactly, but rather the characteristics of the type of champion she is. Squishy early game? Most assasin-esque bruisers have this exact same thing. Cool down reliant? Well, she is a resourcless champion, after all. She is only gated by cool downs and since she has a bit of "hidden" power in her passive with spell casts, her regular non-empowered AAs pale in comparison. Ranged harass? Melee champion. But this isn't much of a weakness unless that ranged champion has some hard cc/soft cc and an escape. Riven will still dash across the lane and slice your face off. Plus that nifty AD scaling shield to soak up the damage that also happens to be a dash to close the distance.

What weaknesses, are there, really? And not just general weaknesses based on her characteristics that her kit otherwise solves. Sounds to me as if you simply want to seem like you're actually doing your job with a rather inconsequential nerf just so when people say 2 years later that we've been asking for you to look at riven you can say, "OHOHOHOHOHOHOHO! But we did, remember back when we nerfed her ult speed? Don't say we didn't ever do anything for you!"

I'm in no way advocating for her to be gutted and I don't believe she is that much of an issue unless the person playing her has had some practice and knows how to optimize her trading potential. But I am saying that she has no definite weaknesses to capitalize on.

Can I say thank you for you guys explaining why a champion gets nerfed or buffed? I think you've gotten better (though not perfect) at explaining balance changes. If Riot explains what a champions strengths are supposed to be (people either forget or not know) vs. their weaknesses, maybe it'll help us debate whether or not these changes are appropriate for a champion's playstyle.

Ok, so what does Riot see as Riven's strengths? I've been listening to a thousand different people give their opinion on Riven, but I've never been sure what Riot meant for her to be good at, especially in the context of present-day champion design and philosophy. Obviously she's maneuverable and is meant to deal sustained damage. On paper, those are the two things she's meant to do with her ult finishing off targets. Is that how she operates though? From my understanding, her best case is canceling all of her animations to compress her damage into as short a time frame as possible. She's a sustained champ who works best as faux-burst champ. That may be a slight exaggeration, but it is true that between her animation canceling, her CC, her short cooldowns and her CDR stacking she can get around the time delay of her damage output while keeping an opponent in place (albeit briefly). Is that a strength Riven is meant to have? Is it her defined strength?

But do you understand that laning against Riven isn't a scenario of 50/50 on the fence decided by the Wind Slash hitting the opponent to tip it one way or another? Laning against Riven is still going to be just as one sided and stressful and unfair. She still has all her damage, all her mobility, and all her cc. Literally all you've done, like you said, is make it so that I can now flash and not die from her ult, making my score 0-3-0 with -50cs instead of 0-4-0 with -50cs.

I HATE laning against Riven, but not because I think she's OP, just because I know how hard she can snowball and I have to play extremely careful against her. It does make your laning phase boring, but I usually win games against riven. Her main weakness is hard CC (knock ups, stuns) but also snare and silence completely wrecks her as 2 of her abilities can't be casted when snared and her mobility is completely gutted when silenced. If you have a team comp that only has slows as CC, you're going to have a very bad time, though.

Hmm....one thing I've always found frustrating is that Riven can be extremely tanky and resilient with zero defensive items built. Largely because A) she has a shield that scales off of AD, which is never a good thing, and B) she has a stun whose damage is also based off of AD, with very little counterplay aside from flashing away before she dashes.

I want to propose two possible ideas. The first is making her shield scale either off of bonus health, or not at all (a la Jarvan's shield ability), and having her stun damage either AP based or bonus health based. Anything that takes out free power scaling from building nothing but AD is a plus for Riven.

Secondly, her charge system. Right now, she is encouraged to use her abilities to stick to people, because abilities make her autoattacks more effective. Since her abilities are on such low cooldown, however, this doesn't really feel rewarding so much as free extra damage that's up all the time. What I would propose is that the charges go THE OTHER WAY. Here, autoattacking would build her charges, and her abilities would be more effective based on how many charges she has. They can still be used without her charges, but, say, her oh-so-exploitable stun would be a slow if you used it without any charges built up, but would stun people when you have charges built up. Every use of an ability would absorb one of those charges, and the power of the ability would depend on how many charges you had when you used it. The exception to this could be her ult: it will absorb ALL the charges, and during her ult (until she either releases it or it just wears off), all her abilities would function as if they were used at full charge capacity, or at the charge capacity she was at before her ult. This way, the charge-building mechanic she has would feel a little more rewarding, I believe, and more like a bit of power that you worked hard to build instead of just...free autoattack damage when you spam your abilities.

So, for example, lets say the cap on your charges is 4. You've just last-hit four minions, so those charges are available to use. You dash, giving you a sizeable shield (max charge level), then stun for a decent amount(level 3), then do your three Q slashes (which absorb only one charge total, level 2). In this example, the shield would've had the strongest "charge" scaling, since it was used when you had 4 charges; it then absorbs one charge. Unless you auto-attacked before hitting the target, the stun would have had a third-level "charge" scaling, and so would've stunned for a good bit of time, but not as long as if it was used at max charges; another charge gone. Next, the three slashes with Q would've done decent damage, but it would NOT burst someone down too quickly, as it was used with only 2 charges stored; now you're down to one charge. Here, you could potentially ult, but if the ult is modified to follow all the other ability patterns, it would only have a 1-charge effectiveness; all abilities used during ult would only be as effective as if you had one charge built, and no charges are built or consumed during ult. Might possibly make ult either automatically place you at max charges, or give two charges when used.

The charges would have to have a LONG duration on them, so that you could, say, max it out doing red buff (if you wanna try jungle Riven), then walk down to bot/top lane to pwn somebody. When they DO fall off, they do so one at a time.
Change her stun into a slow and Riven will be fair. This ult change is a joke.
Riven's not OP, you are being a baby. Learn to play the game.
